BT2025004_syn_1:
Proc: Attempted BT Bilateral Upper Lobes.
Event: Severe bronchospasm at 34 activations.
Action: Aborted procedure. Intubated. ICU transfer.
Findings: Acute respiratory failure.
Plan: ICU care. Mech vent.
BT2025004_syn_2:
OPERATIVE NARRATIVE: The patient presented for completion thermoplasty of the upper lobes. Following induction, the catheter was deployed in the RUL and LUL. After 34 activations, the patient developed precipitous airway expiratory obstruction and severe wheeze consistent with status asthmaticus. 
INTERVENTION: The procedure was immediately aborted. Anesthesia was deepened, and pharmacologic resuscitation initiated. The patient remained intubated for mechanical ventilation.
DISPOSITION: Transfer to ICU for critical care management.
BT2025004_syn_3:
Code: 31660 (Bronchial thermoplasty, 1 lobe).
Rationale: Although bilateral treatment was intended (31661), the procedure was aborted early due to life-threatening bronchospasm. 34 activations suggests treatment of roughly one lobe's worth of tissue before termination.
Complication: Acute respiratory failure (J96.00).
Disposition: ICU.

BT2025004:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Bronchial thermoplasty session 3 treating bilateral upper lobes (aborted early).
Patient: [REDACTED], 56-year-old male with severe steroid-dependent asthma and frequent ICU admissions.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with endotracheal intubation.
Procedure details: After induction of anesthesia, flexible bronchoscopy was performed via endotracheal tube. Bronchial thermoplasty catheter was positioned in the right and left upper lobe segmental bronchi. Thirty-four activations were delivered before abrupt increase in airway pressures and severe wheeze prompted early termination of the procedure.
Complications: Severe bronchospasm with acute hypoxemic respiratory failure requiring deepening of anesthesia, continuous nebulized bronchodilators, IV epinephrine, and continued mechanical ventilation in the ICU. No significant bleeding or pneumothorax.
Disposition: Procedure aborted; patient transported intubated to the ICU for ongoing ventilatory and bronchodilator management.
